UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: The people of Aygethos value labor, loyalty and discipline - but most, the sword and spear. They see that sorcerers again have brought war to Elemental, proof again that magic is not to be trusted. In battle, the spear men of Aygethos will prove their superiority over the arcane.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: All kingdoms long for peace and prosperity that in these times seem an impossibility, but it is the Siirdi who believe it is their destiny. Descended from the great nation of Sirionne, these people seek to re-establish the Holy Kingdom because it is faith in the Light that will once again unite the races of men.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: The Nothari lost their treasured iceland homeland to the cataclysm. As nomads they have managed to survive - but it is the lack of assistance from the other nations that the Nothari remember the most. Now under Myrthani they are tending a beautiful new homeland. Relations with other Kingdoms may prove more difficult to grow.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: The people of Raktur can trace their bloodline back to the time of the Magi. The origin of their affinity with fire however, is uncertain. Some say they are descended from the Magi themselves, other that it is an old hint of dragon in their blood. Now, after the cataclysm, the Raktur hope to recover the secrets of their birthright in flame.

Now, after the cataclysm, the Raktur hope to recover the secrets of their birthright in flame.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: Few races know the cost of war like the Dremorian people. One hundred years of war with the trolls has decimated their once great nation. The Dremorian affinity with earth and forest and beast made the Cataclysm's destruction almost too much for them to bear. Now, their spears are kept sharp and scouts alert, for their history tells them the endurance of peace is but leaves in the wind.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: The people of Urns have always had a close affinity to nature, preferring open fields and woodland groves to city streets. And now after the cataclysm the Urns elders hear the lament of those few surviving trees. As these fledgling forests struggle to recover from Cataclysm, the guardians of Urns will ensure any who threaten the trees die swiftly.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: The people of Otaran are not known as warriors. They are skilled craftsmen and a studied people, believing in logic and reason, and that power comes though knowledge and understanding. By their knowledge, the Otaran mastered the lost arts of alchemy and golem craft. Should the war in Elemental arrive in Otaran, its scholars shall be ready to defend themselves.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: The people of Cormenlon fancy themselves as more cultured than most, for Cormenlon is a wealthy nation, with some of the largest and advanced cities in Elemental. Diplomacy and accounting are widely considered more useful skills than swordsmanship. Yet the might of arms will be needed to keep Fallen and men alike at bay, now that war again brews in Elemental...

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: The Xaroch are a new people, their origins a mystery having only appeared on Elemental following the cataclysm. They are intelligent and patient, living longer lifespan than the other races. This longevity and a natural affinity with the arcane also breeds an unhealthy arrogance and distaste towards the other races, particularly the obnoxious and unpredictable races of men.

According to Janusk of Krandir, those youths who enter the citadel break off all contact with their families, change their names, and pledge their lives to the service of the Emperor Karavox. According to Karavox's ambassadors, none of that is true.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: Of all the Fallen it is the beastmen of Thuhl that epitomize the ethos of the Empires: the strong rule, the weak suffer. They are cruel and savage, killing themselves as often as other races. But now, under the dominance of the warlord Bhargol, the united Thuhl tribes may rule all of Elemental.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: When the Nothari people were almost destroyed during the cataclysm, not all survivors followed Myrthani to search for a new home. A faithless lot chose the underground as their new home. In these dark tunnels their faith in shadows was rewarded, and the Sholdari were born.

UnitType.Description: Defenders are formidable troops that are able to outlast enemy units and absorb lots of damage.
UnitType.Backstory: These are the eyes of the Enchantress; those fighters charged as Resoln's first line of defense against invaders. According to Gradzh of Hedigah, sole survivor of Kraxis's failed attempt to seize the city of Maz Galuur in the south of that country, these sentinels have been bewitched; their lifespans shortened by half, in order that they may serve without the need for sleep.

UnitType.Description: Barons are powerful melee units, able to do lots of damage to those that fall within their range.
UnitType.Backstory: When the Nothari people were almost destroyed during the cataclysm, not all survivors followed Myrthani to search for a new home. A faithless lot chose the underground as their new home. In these dark tunnels their faith in shadows was rewarded, and the Sholdari were born.

UnitType.Description: Warg Riders are excellent for scouting out unknown areas, and escaping when they uncover dangers in those areas. The Tide is known for nipping at the heels of powerful enemies. The tactic is frequently suicide, but unquestioningly effective.
UnitType.Backstory: "Now you are the whirlwind; warg and rider, one flesh from two. Reap me a harvest of bright, red blood." - The Enchantress These are mounted units of the Wraith army; warriors upon wargs, whose unearthly speed and savage ferocity have given rise to rumors of cannibalism upon the battliefield.

UnitType.Description: Axeman are good early skirmishers, though they can't wield shields their Cleave ability allows them to attack multiple enemies at once.
UnitType.Backstory: When the Nothari people were almost destroyed during the cataclysm, not all survivors followed Myrthani to search for a new home. A faithless lot chose the underground as their new home. In these dark tunnels their faith in shadows was rewarded, and the Sholdari were born.

UnitType.Description: Gravewardens are mages that draw the lives from those they kill, adding it to their faction's mana.
UnitType.Backstory: "Take pleasure in the killing, for it is what you were made to do." - The Enchantress These are Wraith sorcerers trained in the arts of war; mages who share the Enchantress's blood, and thus, a bit of her power.

UnitType.Description: Witches are powerful ranged attackers with high mobility. Easily able to skirt around slower units and wear them down. Even worse, once the witch kills a victim that opponents life is collected as mana.
UnitType.Backstory: These sorcerers are the stuff of nightmares; Wraith enchantresses, bonded by sorcery to warg mounts. They were the first wave of Ceresa's creatures to attack Goyarh Hedigah, and after the city fell, they were said to have rended the Tazzar's body limb from limb, and carried it back to the caves of Gamush Ked to feast upon his brains and blood.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: All who wear the colors of this army, from commander to common foot-soldier, can trace their lineage back to the great kingdoms of the pre-cataclysmic era - to Coriopolis, Zad-Zabril, and even fabled Antheros. The blood of the channelers of old runs in their veins; they know and are unafraid of using this power to aid them in combat, both as shield and sword, in defense and attack. The commander who would engage this army in battle most possess a similar familiarity with the enchanter's art.

UnitType.Description: Archers are lightly equipped and skilled at picking off their opponents at a distance.
UnitType.Backstory: These are the archers of Pariden, Amarians who are masters of the bow, trained in the same manner and using the same drills as the Ninety-Nine of Redstone. And no wonder - for their namesake, Galadwenn of the Free Cities, was himself heir to the Bow of Ydrain, said to have been used by Argynn in his war against the tribes of the Khulan.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: Often mistaken for their Fallen kin the Trogs, the warriors of Gorgal adopt a more strategic view of the world. They know that there can be a time for planning, and a use for allies. The Gorgal have forged pacts with many of the twisted creatures of Elemental, and this strength of numbers may bring them control of the world.

UnitType.Backstory: "The sound of their boots upon the city's cobblestones shall haunt my dreams, in this life and the next." - Hengut the Younger of Odenvell. Trog heavy infantry. The armies of the Titans of old - the endless swarms of soldiers depicted in the great paintings and murals recovered from Imperium's ruins - were often led by units similar to these, whose appearance foretold the coming of battle, of death and destruction.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: The Morquai are an accomplished people ruled by an autocratic noble class. Prior to the cataclysm, the Empire was experiencing a golden age - but the nobles are threatened by the current Empress Ritheria. Coming to power in questionable circumstance, she has grand designs for the future of the Morquai she keeps dearly secret.

UnitType.Backstory: These are the elite soldiers of the Krax army, who receive both their training and their unit names in the citadel of the Warrior, in the heart of Tanacabra. According to Janusk of Krandir, those youths who enter the citadel break off all contact with their families, change their names, and pledge their lives to the service of the Emperor Karavox. According to Karavox's ambassadors, none of that is true.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: The Gaush barbarian tribes started as little more than raiding savages, attacking caravans and pillaging towns to survive. Constant warring amongst themselves has filtered out the weak, and focused their culture on warfare. Now the Gaush are united, and will subsist upon the greater cities of Elemental.

UnitType.Backstory: The Gaush barbarian tribes started as little more than raiding savages, attacking caravans and pillaging towns to survive. Constant warring amongst themselves has filtered out the weak, and focused their culture on warfare. Now the Gaush are united, and will subsist upon the greater cities of Elemental.

UnitType.Description: Maruaders are elite warriors who live for battle.
UnitType.Backstory: The Gaush barbarian tribes started as little more than raiding savages, attacking caravans and pillaging towns to survive. Constant warring amongst themselves has filtered out the weak, and focused their culture on warfare. Now the Gaush are united, and will subsist upon the greater cities of Elemental.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: These are Elemental's most fearsome warriors; bred for battle, taught to strike without mercy and to ignore pain, to banish the words 'caution' and 'surrender' from their vocabulary. Whether you engage them in single combat, or fight them in phalanxes, you will learn the truth of those words attributed to Iskahar, last of Ereog's line, as he lay dying on the steppes of Engar. "It is no shame to perish to a superior foe."

UnitType.Description: Harbingers of War are powerful melee units, able to do lots of damage to those that fall within their range. They are the most elite of the Trog armies and not many can withstand their attacks.
UnitType.Backstory: "The sound of their boots upon the city's cobblestones shall haunt my dreams, in this life and the next." - Hengut the Younger of Odenvell. Trog heavy infantry. The armies of the Titans of old - the endless swarms of soldiers depicted in the great paintings and murals recovered from Imperium's ruins - were often led by units similar to these, whose appearance foretold the coming of battle, of death and destruction.

UnitType.Description: Warg riders are excellent for scouting out unknown areas, and escaping when they uncover dangers in those areas.

UnitType.Description: Axeman are good early skirmishers, though they can't wield shields their Cleave ability allows them to attack multiple enemies at once.

UnitType.Description: The Chosen are outfitted with enchanted weapons and items. They are a powerful tool for any empire, but expensive to train.

UnitType.Description: The Battleborn are good midgame units for your armies. Do not mistake them for the lumbering brutes they appear to be, their training is extensive and prepares them well for battle.
UnitType.Backstory: "I am father to a thousand children; to hearts that never falter, to limbs that never tire, to battlelust that is never quenched!" - The Warlord Verga These are soldiers of the Trog army; Fallen creatures fashioned in the depths of N'it'vaganesh for one purpose only... war.

UnitType.Description: The Gray March are effective against well armored enemies. They are stronger than other faction's spearmen and are drawn from the largest of the Trog.
UnitType.Backstory: "It is a sea of lances I spy in the morning fog; a formation that comes ever, ever closer. I fear for our army, my love; I fear for our country, and yes, I fear for my own life as well." - Duc Lonte, 13th Baron of Ithul, writing to his wife as he prepared to battle the assembled armies of Sodesh Jushi, warlord of the Trogs. The Gray March are the spearmen of the Trog (D'Rog) army; though they often form the front line of defense, these soldiers are not content to merely await attack, but will often be found initiating it.
